resources.string: Network Protection is enabled and routing all device traffic through %1$s.
Network Protection interrupted. Attempting to reconnect now…
Network Protection failed to connect. Please try again later.
Network Protection is ON. Your location and online activity are protected.
Connection interrupted. Attempting to reconnect now…
Failed to connect. Please try again later.
Your VPN app may be disconnected
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Enabling Network Protection may disconnect any active VPN on your device.
Your VPN app is blocking Network Protection
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Open Network settings > VPN. Find the VPN app that’s “always-on” and disable it to continue.
Go to your device’s VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and enable Always-on VPN to prevent Android disabling protection.\n\nMake sure to leave the other setting OFF.
To avoid app issues, go to your device\'s VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and disable Block connections without VPN.
Network Protection is disabled.\nA VPN app on your device may have disabled it. Use the toggle to re-enable.
Action required! To avoid app issues, you need to change your Android settings. Change settings
Your time in the waiting list is over.
Secure your internet traffic and keep your browsing history private with Network Protection, a VPN by DuckDuckGo
You\'re invited to test a beta feature!
Error joining the Waitlist, please try again later
DuckDuckGo Network Protection is currently in closed, invite-only beta.
DuckDuckGo will never log, track, or share your network data.
We\'ll send you a notification when Network Protection is ready for you.
Your invite to try Network Protection will arrive here. Check back soon, or we can send you a notification when it\'s your turn.
Get a notification when your copy of DuckDuckGo for Windows is ready for download.

We didn\'t recognise this Invite Code.
Error redeeming code, please try again later
You\'re invited to try Network Protection Beta!
New invites are sent every few days, on a first come first server basis.\n\nWe\'ll notify you when your invite is ready.
Network Protection is a VPN. Enable to secure all your internet traffic on this device and keep your browsing history private.
We send invites every few days.
We can notify you when its your turn.
Everyday protection for everything you do online
Network Protection uses the WireGuard protocol to secure all your network activity across your device, protecting your browsing, app activity and beyond.
Fast, reliable and easy to use
Network Protection comes built-in to the DuckDuckGo browser. Connect to the nearest with one click.
Unlike other VPNs, we do not store logs of your data. It\'s in our Privacy Policy.
Network Protection is free to use during beta.
Network Protection works across all apps by default. If you’re experiencing app issues with Network Protection enabled, try disabling protection for that app.
App issues may occur if enabled

string.name: netpExclusionListManuallyDisableAppDialogLabel
string.instruction: Placeholder is the name of an app

resources.string: Please let us know if you disabled Network Protection for %1$s because you experienced app issues.\n\nWe\'ll also disable App Tracking Protection for %1$s.
Report an Issue With an App
This will update your custom protection settings and enable Network Protection for all apps. You can always change your protection settings again later.
Enabling protection sends the app\'s name to DuckDuckGo.

A virtual private network, commonly known as a VPN, protects your privacy and anonymity online by hiding your IP address so websites and apps can\'t identify you or your location by accessing your real IP address. VPNs also encrypt the data sent over your device\'s network connection so information that could otherwise reveal your identity or your online activities (e.g., the links you click, the files you download, or the messages you send) is obscured from others on the same network.\n\nUsing a VPN when connecting to public Wi-Fi, in places like coffee shops or airports, prevents your private information and browsing habits from being exposed to others on the network. Using a VPN on your home network hides your web browsing history from your Internet service provider, who could otherwise log and sell that information to third parties.

A VPN allows you to re-route your online activity through a remote server in another location operated by the VPN provider. This ensures that websites and apps see the remote server\'s IP address location instead of your real one. VPNs also encrypt (or scramble) data in-transit, so others can\'t read it.\n\nThere can be some drawbacks to using a VPN. Depending on how far away you are from the remote server, your Internet speed may be affected. Some websites and apps also intentionally limit access to people using a VPN. Additionally, some VPN providers may also log and share your online activity with 3rd parties. Using a VPN with a "no logging" privacy policy like DuckDuckGo\'s Network Protection is recommended.

Network Protection uses the open source WireGuard protocol to configure a virtual private network (VPN) on your device. When enabled, all of your device traffic is first encrypted and then routed through the nearest VPN server to protect your browsing activity from Internet service providers and hide your location from apps and sites you visit.
Is only my web browsing protected?
All of the network activity on your device is protected.
Does DuckDuckGo keep logs of my data?
No, we do not store logs.
Where are DuckDuckGo VPN servers located?
DuckDuckGo offers a limited number of servers while Network Protection is in beta, located in the United States and Europe.
Why can\'t I choose my server location?
Network Protection automatically selects the nearest server to you to maintain the highest connection speed possible while browsing.
Why do some apps not work when Network Protection is on?

Some websites and apps intentionally limit access to people using a VPN. For example, they may ask you to solve a CAPTCHA to ensure you\'re a real person instead of a bot. If you experience repeated issues with an app, you can exclude it from the VPN altogether under Network Protection settings.
Why can\'t I dismiss the Network Protection notifications?
Android requires that VPNs show a persistent notification while the VPN is enabled.
Is Network Protection compatible with App Tracking Protection?
Yes, both Network Protection and App Tracking Protection can be on at the same time. No other VPNs are compatible with DuckDuckGo App Tracking Protection.
Is Network Protection free to use?
Network Protection is free to use while in beta. Eventually it will be offered as a paid service.

1.1 "VPN Service" refers to the software and associated services provided by XYZ Corp. ("Provider") to facilitate secure and private internet connectivity.\n\n1.2 "User" refers to any individual or entity who accesses or uses the VPN Service.

2.1 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Provider grants User a non-exclusive, non-transferable license to use the VPN Service for personal or internal business purposes. \n\n2.2 User may not distribute, modify, reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or create derivative works based on the VPN Service.

3.1 User agrees to use the VPN Service in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations. 

3.2 User agrees not to use the VPN Service for any illegal, harmful, or unauthorized purposes, including but not limited to: accessing or sharing copyrighted content, engaging in fraudulent activities, transmitting viruses or malware, or infringing upon the rights of others. 

3.3 User acknowledges that the VPN Service is not a guarantee of complete privacy and agrees not to hold Provider liable for any unauthorized access, data breaches, or loss of data.
Network Protection is disabled. Tap to continue securing your device traffic.
A VPN app on your device disabled Network Protection. Tap to re-enable.
